value.title: Google’s Firing of an Ethics Researcher Shows the Limits of Having ‘a Seat at the Table’
value.excerpt: On Monday, a team of Google employees published a letter explaining the events leading up to Google’s firing of Dr. Timnit Gebru, a prominent AI ethics researcher whose work has helped to reveal racial bias in facial recognition algorithms.

value.title: The trouble with AI: Why we need new laws to stop algorithms ruining our lives
value.excerpt: Ethical guidelines are the only tool to date to control AI systems. They're not doing much for our rights, finds a new report.

value.title: AI development promoting educational reform, innovation: TAL Education Group Chairman
value.excerpt: TAL Education Group Chairman and President Bai Yunfeng on Monday said that the integration of artificial intelligence and education was moving towards the in-depth field of educational ecology, promoting the innovation and reform from educational concept to teaching technology.

value.title: Researchers are starting to refuse to review Google AI papers
value.excerpt: Computer scientists are beginning to refuse to review Google AI papers until Google changes its stance on former ethics co-lead Timnit Gebru.

value.title: AI Ethics Scholar’s Exit Adds to Google’s Employment Practices Woes
value.excerpt: Prominent artificial intelligence scholar Timnit Gebru helped improve Google's public image as a company that elevates Black computer scientists and

value.title: Google widely criticized after parting ways with a leading voice in AI ethics
value.excerpt: Many Google employees and others in the tech and academic communities are furious over the sudden exit from Google of a pioneer in the study of ethics in artificial intelligence—a departure they see as a failure by an industry titan to foster an environment supportive of diversity.

value.title: AI Weekly: In firing Timnit Gebru, Google puts commercial interests ahead of ethics
value.excerpt: With the firing of Timnit Gebru this week, Google implicitly signaled that it's willing to put commercial interests ahead of all else.

value.title: Google staff hit out at effort to 'silence' AI ethics leader
value.excerpt: More than 400 employees of the US firm signed a letter saying Timnit Gebru's departure was 'a moment of reckoning beyond Google'

value.title: Google Scientist’s Abrupt Exit Exposes Rift in Prominent AI Unit
value.excerpt: Google’s decision to part ways with a prominent researcher laid bare divisions within the company’s artificial intelligence unit and subjected its leader, the lauded software engineer Jeff Dean, to widespread scorn.

value.title: Black Ethical AI Researcher Says Google Fired Her Over A Critical Email
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru, a co-leader of the Ethical Artificial Intelligence team at Google, said she was fired for sending an email that was allegedly deemed “inconsistent with the expectations of a Google manager.

value.title: AI ethics pioneer’s exit from Google involved research into risks and inequality in large language models
value.excerpt: AI research at the center of Google AI co-lead Timit Gebru's exit focuses on the bias, risks, and inequality tied to deploying large language models.

value.title: Top AI ethics researcher says Google fired her; company denies it
value.excerpt: A top Google scientist on ethical artificial intelligence says she was fired after criticizing the company's diversity efforts, a claim the Alphabet Inc unit disputed on Thursday, in the latest brush-up between the internet giant and worker activists.

value.title: A Prominent AI Ethics Researcher Says Google Fired Her
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru is a leader among those examining the societal impacts of the technology. She had also criticized the company's diversity efforts.

value.title: Daily Crunch: Google fires co-lead of its Ethical AI team
value.excerpt: Google fires a leading researcher, Stripe launches a new banking service and WarnerMedia shakes up the theatrical business model. This is your Daily Crunch for. The big story: Google fires co-lead of its Ethical AI team Timnit Gebru,

value.title: Google’s Co-Head of Ethical AI Says She Was Fired for Email
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru, a co-leader of the Ethical Artificial Intelligence team at Google, said she was fired for sending an email that management deemed “inconsistent with the expectations of a Google manager.

value.title: How AI works: An introduction coming to a school near you
value.excerpt: Students from elementary to high school can take a course in AI and its societal and ethical implications offered within the year by the Microsoft and Code.org partnership.

value.title: Microsoft teams up with Code.org to teach students how AI works
value.excerpt: Microsoft and Code.org have formed an alliance with the goal of providing AI-related educational resources to elementary and high school students, courtesy of Microsoft's $7.5 million donation.

value.title: Biden Aides’ Ties to Consulting and Investment Firms Pose Ethics Test
value.excerpt: Some of the president-elect’s choices for top posts have done work for undisclosed corporate clients and aided a fund that invests in government contractors.

value.title: How The Department Of Defense Approaches Ethical AI
value.excerpt: Military and defense organizations using AI and machine learning can realize tremendous advantages over increasingly capable adversaries and competitors. But there is also a risk of unintended consequences.

value.title: Ethical AI isn’t the same as trustworthy AI, and that matters
value.excerpt: Certainly, unethical systems create mistrust. It does not follow, however, that an ethical system will be categorically trusted.

value.title: Aides’ Ties to Firms Present Biden With Early Ethics Test
value.excerpt: Some of the president-elect’s choices for top posts have done work for undisclosed corporate clients and aided a fund that invests in government contractors.

value.title: Emily Murphy, Administrator Of The GSA Shares Her Thoughts On AI
value.excerpt: Being recently thrust into the news, Emily Murphy, Administrator of the GSA might have rather been known for the impact she has helped make on the GSA's use of AI and automation to change the way the government procures and uses technology services.

value.title: Who will your algorithm harm next? Why businesses need to start thinking about evil AI now
value.excerpt: Building AI systems that are ethical is no longer a box-ticking exercise, and could deliver a key competitive advantage to the businesses that embrace responsible technology.

value.title: The impact of machine learning & AI on advertising in a privacy compliant age
value.excerpt: Sian Williams, Audience Strategy and Planning Director at MediaCom North, explains how AI offers a future of increased automation, faster decision-making and ‘hyper-personalisation’ that will make marketing comms more effective and businesses more efficient.

value.title: The ethical use of AI will help businesses when engaging with customers
value.excerpt: Dries Cronje, CEO if Deep Learning Café, says that ethics will play a critical role as more businesses leverage AI in order to tap into customer trends.

value.title: The 7 Most Promising Government Led AI Solutions
value.excerpt: From the US to Canada, and Denmark to Estonia, massive governmental initiatives are being mobilized to boost AI solutions across sectors. The efforts that nations put forth now on the digital front will define our globe's leaders and laggards in digitalization.

value.title: Scholars Delve Deeper Into The Ethics Of Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: "Take driverless cars," he says. "If there's an accident involving a driverless car, what policies do we have in place? What kind of insurance coverage do they have? And who needs to take insurance?"

value.title: Education about AI to begin in high schools next year
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) will be introduced as a new subject in local high schools next year before being expanded to the curriculums of kindergartens and elementary and middle schools by 2025, the education ministry said Friday,

value.title: How Companies Can Develop Ethical AI Technology For The Future
value.excerpt: Companies cannot ignore the risks associated with ethical AI applications, but guidelines need to be more palatable and concrete in order to fuel progress.

value.title: Savvy enterprises can mimic success of cognitive AI in healthcare
value.excerpt: Cognitive technologies are being deployed to solve the world’s biggest challenges. AI-based bots are working side-by-side with humans to increase quality and efficiency. Here’s how enterprises can put cognitive AI to work in their organizations.
